scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly, and you expressed that if the team needs you this often, they need to learn to cope without you. [Bob] raises an eyebrow slightly.
scenes.description: [Bob] sighs, 'I get your point, [Alex], but what if this attitude creates resentment among the team? We all depend on each other.'

options.text: Resentment is a two-way street, Bob. Maybe we need to have a team discussion about boundaries.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the potential issue and propose a balanced solution, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: You're right, Bob. Perhaps I should have been more tactful in expressing my concerns.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern, showing empathy and emotional perception but lower social skills and motivation.

options.text: If being honest about my limits creates resentment, then maybe our team dynamics need re-evaluating.
